decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game with a variety of spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It utilizes powerful removal spells like Supreme Verdict, Abrupt Decay, and Path to Exile to deal with threats, while also having a versatile counter package with cards like Cryptic Command and Force of Negation. The deck also includes value-generating cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl to help maintain board presence and outvalue the opponent in the long game.

The deck focuses on creating a fast, resilient, and evasive threat using creatures with hexproof and powerful Aura enchantments to pump them up and protect them. By building a formidable creature that opponents have a hard time dealing with, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game. It relies on a combination of protection, evasion, and power boosts to create a strong offense that is difficult to disrupt.

The deck focuses on utilizing various artifacts and creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in gameplay. The deck's win condition revolves around efficiently generating mana with Urza, utilizing powerful creatures like Uro, and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of threats and disruption.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game in a single turn. By using cards like Ad Nauseam and Spoils of the Vault to draw through the deck, players can find and play Thassa's Oracle to win instantly. Phyrexian Unlife and Angel's Grace can protect the player from losing the game due to drawing out their deck, while Pentad Prism and Lotus Bloom provide the necessary mana acceleration. The inclusion of Pact of Negation helps to protect the combo from disruption, ensuring a swift victory.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with the help of Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands, enabling the player to cast Primeval Titan and quickly search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and other lands. The main goal is to create a powerful combo where Valakut can deal a massive amount of damage thanks to the number of Mountains in play, while also creating zombie tokens with Field of the Dead. With the right sequence of plays, this deck can overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of land drops and titan searches.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and ramp while setting up for a game-winning Scapeshift. It also utilizes cards like Uro, Ice-Fang Coatl, and Wrenn and Six to generate value and card advantage. The Companion choice of Yorion adds additional value by allowing for additional flicker effects. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements and maximize the chances of assembling the key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents before closing out the game with a lethal Scapeshift.

This Modern Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck also utilizes disruption with Chalice of the Void and removal spells like Dismember to control the board. With Karn, the Great Creator providing utility and access to powerful artifacts, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive creatures and efficient mana ramp. The key strategy is to deploy threats quickly and disrupt opponents' game plans to secure a swift victory.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail. With a mix of efficient threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, along with disruptive spells like Dismember and All Is Dust, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with an aggressive game plan. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator gives the deck additional versatility and the ability to tutor for powerful artifacts to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

Utilize powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the game while ramping up mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. Magus of the Moon and Pillage disrupt opponents' mana bases while Bonecrusher Giant and Lightning Bolt take care of threats. Seasoned Pyromancer provides card advantage and Kitchen Finks helps stabilize against aggressive decks. Klothys, God of Destiny provides graveyard hate and lifegain. Obosh, the Preypiercer serves as a companion to boost damage output. The deck aims to control the board, disrupt opponents' plans, and close out the game with powerful creatures.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to quickly apply pressure to the opponent, using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's plan. Mishra's Bauble and Cling to Dust provide card advantage and help with setting up draws. With a low mana curve and consistent damage output, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to play out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game and prevent opponents from executing their game plan. The inclusion of Emrakul, the Promised End provides a powerful finisher, while cards like Dismember and Walking Ballista offer removal and flexibility in dealing with threats on the board. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays and disruptive tactics.

This deck focuses on utilizing the "Hardened Scales" enchantment to maximize the number of +1/+1 counters placed on creatures. By playing cards like Walking Ballista, Hangarback Walker, and Arcbound Ravager, the deck is able to quickly build up a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The inclusion of cards like The Ozolith and Animation Module provide additional ways to generate and transfer counters, making it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the growing threats on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to control the flow of the game. The deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its aggressive creatures and also has access to removal options like Dismember and Spatial Contortion to deal with threats. Overall, the strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board throughout the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast, efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to deal early damage, along with Lightning Bolt and Seal of Fire to finish off opponents, the deck seeks to maintain constant pressure. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion, ensuring the deck can continue its aggressive strategy throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to gather resources, control the game, and outlast the opponent through disruption and powerful card advantage. Utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to stabilize the board while generating incremental value. The inclusion of powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional card advantage and win conditions. Ultimately, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and win through incremental advantages rather than overwhelming aggression.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells and removal, using planeswalkers like Jace and Teferi for card advantage and disruption. The deck utilizes a mix of countermagic, board wipes, and card draw to keep the opponent's threats in check while setting up win conditions like Entreat the Angels. The deck also includes a companion, Kaheera, for additional utility and synergy with the deck's creature base. With a robust mana base and a suite of powerful control spells, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in longer games.
